original: EXHIBIT 10.1 STRATEGIC SALES & MARKETING AGREEMENT THIS STRATEGIC SALES & MARKETING AGREEMENT (the “ Agreement ”) is effective as of the last date provided for on the signature page and is entered into by and between SightLife Surgical, Inc., a Delaware corporation, having its principal place of business at 1200 6th Ave, Ste.
ollama_generated:
EXHIBIT 10.1 STRATEGIC SALES & MARKETING AGREEMENT

This STRATEGIC SALES & MARKETING AGREEMENT (the "Agreement") is effective as of the first date provided for on the signature page and is entered into by and between SightLife Surgical, Inc., a Delaware corporation, having its principal place of business at 1200 6th Ave, Ste.

The Agreement's effectiveness shall be contingent upon the mutual agreement of both parties as to all terms herein, which agreement may be given by either party within fifteen (15) days from the date of this Agreement. In the event that no such agreement is reached within said timeframe, this Agreement shall be deemed null and void.

In the event of any disagreement or dispute arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, the parties shall make every effort to resolve the matter amicably through good-faith negotiations. If they are unable to reach a resolution, either party may submit the matter to binding arbitration in accordance with the rules of the American Arbitration Association then in effect.

The performance or failure to perform any obligation under this Agreement by either party shall not be considered a breach of this Agreement unless such non-performance continues for thirty (30) days after written notice has been given by one party to the other. In the event of such breach, the non-breaching party may terminate this Agreement upon providing written notice to the breaching party.

SightLife Surgical, Inc. acknowledges and agrees that it shall be solely responsible for any and all sales or marketing activities conducted pursuant to this Agreement. It understands and accepts that it shall bear any and all associated costs, risks, and liabilities arising from such activities.

In the event that any provision of this Agreement is found to be invalid or unenforceable by a court of competent jurisdiction, the remainder of the Agreement shall remain in full force and effect. The invalid or unenforceable provision shall be deemed modified to the extent necessary to render it valid and enforceable, or if it cannot be so modified, stricken and the parties shall negotiate in good faith to agree upon a valid and enforceable substitute provision as closely as possible reflecting the original intent of the parties.

1. Representative Sales Duties:

In contrast to the original clause, this revised version weakens the obligation by reducing it to "duties," thereby implying a lesser degree of responsibility compared to "services." The term "Sales Representation Services" implies a comprehensive set of tasks and activities, whereas "Representative Sales Duties" is more focused on specific actions related to sales.

Here's the revised clause:

1. Representative Sales Duties: The [Party A] shall perform such duties as may be reasonably required by [Party B], including, but not limited to, soliciting and promoting the sale of the goods or services provided by [Party B]. The [Party A] is under no obligation to achieve any sales targets or meet specific quotas set by [Party B], unless otherwise agreed in writing. Any costs, expenses, or penalties arising from the performance of these duties shall be solely borne by the [Party A], unless otherwise stipulated in this Agreement.

original: 2.2.Surgical shall immediately cease to provide any further Services under this Agreement and/or any applicable SOW upon receipt of notice from Imprimis that Imprimis is terminating this Agreement and/or such SOW. Upon termination of this Agreement and/or such SOW, Surgical shall be entitled to payment for Services completed prior to such termination. Thereafter, Imprimis shall owe  Surgical no further amounts or obligations in law or equity.
modified: 2.2. In the event that Surgical receives notice from Imprimis regarding the termination of this Agreement and/or any associated SOW, Surgical shall have the option to complete any outstanding Services under this Agreement for compensation as per the prevailing rates at the time of termination. After the completion and payment for these Services, any further amounts or obligations owed by Imprimis to Surgical under law or equity shall cease.

original: 4.Sales Commission Payment . Within sixty (60) days after the end of each calendar quarter during the Term, Imprimis shall deliver  to Surgical a report setting forth for such calendar quarter the calculation of the applicable Sales Commission due under  this Agreement for the sale of the Product (as defined in the SOW). Imprimis shall remit the total Sales Commission payments  due for the sale of Product during such calendar quarter at the time such report is made.
ollama_generated:
4. Sales Commission Payment Timing . Surgical shall have sixty (60) days, following the close of each calendar quarter during the Term, to receive from Imprimis a report outlining the calculation methodology for the Sales Commission owed under this Agreement, based on Product sales (as defined in the SOW), for that particular quarter. Any amounts due for the quarter's Product sales shall be remitted by Imprimis to Surgical concurrently with the submission of this report.

In this revised clause, the timing of the report submission and commission payment has been slightly adjusted. Instead of Imprimis delivering the report and making the payment within 60 days after the end of each quarter, Surgical now has 60 days to receive the report and Imprimis must remit any owed payments at the same time the report is submitted. This change weakens the initial obligation on Imprimis slightly by giving Surgical a longer period to request and review the report before the payment is due.

original: 6.Confidentiality . Concurrently with this Agreement, the parties shall enter into a confidentiality agreement (the “ Confidentiality  Agreement ”), a copy of which has been attached hereto as  Exhibit A , which shall govern the confidentiality  of any Confidential Information (as defined in the Confidentiality Agreement) disclosed between the parties. In addition,  Surgical shall, at Imprimis’ request and in Imprimis’ sole discretion, if given access to patient health information,  execute a “Business Associate Agreements” as required by the U.S. Health Insurance Portability and Accountability  Act of 1996 (“ HIPAA”).
ollama_generated:
6. Confidentiality Obligations: As a supplement to this Agreement, both parties agree to abide by the terms of the attached Confidentiality Agreement (as Exhibit A), which serves as our guiding principle for maintaining confidentiality regarding any information designated as Confidential Information under said agreement. Furthermore, Surgical shall, upon Imprimis' discretion and at Imprimis' request, sign a "Business Associate Agreement" in compliance with the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA), should access to patient health information be granted.

In this revised clause, the parties agree to abide by the Confidentiality Agreement instead of simply entering into it, which subtly strengthens their commitment to maintaining confidentiality. Additionally, the obligation for Surgical to execute a Business Associate Agreement is now contingent upon being requested and granted access to patient health information, rather than concurrently with this agreement, which shifts the responsibility slightly onto Imprimis.

original: 7.2.Subject to the SOW, Imprimis acknowledges that Surgical may perform services for other clients. Surgical represents and warrants that as of the Effective Date, there is no conflict of interest which would prevent Surgical from performing the Services for Imprimis,  and that Surgical is not under any legal or contractual relationship with any third party which is inconsistent with any provision  of this Agreement. During the Term of this Agreement, Surgical will not to enter into any other agreement or arrangement that  will directly or indirectly compete with the Services to be rendered hereunder, as such agreement shall be considered a breach  of this Agreement. In the event that Surgical becomes aware of any potential or actual conflicts of interest regarding the  provision of the Services, Surgical shall promptly disclose the fact and nature of such conflict to Imprimis.
ollama_generated: 7.2. Pursuant to the SOW, Imprimis acknowledges that Surgical may concurrently provide services to other clients. Surgical assures Imprimis, however, that no such activities will interfere with or compromise the quality and commitment of the Services to be rendered under this Agreement. It is acknowledged that Surgical may have pre-existing legal or contractual obligations with third parties; provided these do not conflict with the provisions of this Agreement, they shall be permitted. During the Term of this Agreement, Surgical reserves the right to enter into agreements or arrangements that may indirectly complement the Services herein, without such actions being considered a breach of this Agreement, unless explicitly stipulated otherwise. In the event that Surgical perceives a potential or actual conflict of interest in providing the Services, Imprimis shall be immediately notified of the nature and extent of such conflict.

original: 10.Tax Indemnity . Surgical agrees to indemnify and hold harmless Imprimis from any and all claims or demands under the Internal  Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, or any state or local tax law or ordinance in respect of any failure of Imprimis to withhold  income tax, FICA or any other tax from the Sales Commissions paid to Surgical, including any interest or penalties relating  thereto and any costs or expenses incurred in defending such claims.
ollama_generated:
10. Tax Liability Shift . Imprimis agrees to assume and cover all liabilities arising from any claims or demands under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, or any state or local tax law or ordinance, in relation to Surgical's obligation to remit income tax, FICA, or any other tax deductions from the Sales Commissions paid to Surgical. This includes any penalties, interest, and costs associated with these obligations, as well as expenses incurred during the defense of such claims.

This modification places the responsibility for taxes on Imprimis, shifting the obligation from Surgical to them.

original: 11.2.Insurance . Each party shall maintain insurance, including comprehensive or commercial general liability and products liability insurance  (contractual liability included), with respect to its activities under this Agreement in such amounts and with such limits  as reasonable and customary in the industry, but with limits not less than the following: (a) each occurrence, one million  dollars ($1,000,000); (b) products/completed operations aggregate, five million dollars ($5,000,000); (c) personal and advertising  injury, one million dollars ($1,000,000); and (d) general aggregate (commercial form only), five million dollars ($5,000,000).  Each Party shall maintain such insurance for so long as it continues its activities under this Agreement, and thereafter for  so long as it customarily maintains insurance for itself covering similar activities.
ollama_generated: 11.2.Insurance Obligations: While each party is expected to maintain the aforementioned insurance policies – comprehensive or commercial general liability, products liability (encompassing contractual liability), with reasonable and customary coverage limits in the industry – it should be noted that the minimum coverage levels prescribed herein are suggestions rather than strict requirements. The parties shall aim for the following limits: (a) each occurrence, one million dollars ($1,000,000); (b) products/completed operations aggregate, five million dollars ($5,000,000); (c) personal and advertising injury, one million dollars ($1,000,000); and (d) general aggregate (commercial form only), five million dollars ($5,000,000). Parties are not required to maintain this insurance for the entire duration of their activities under this Agreement. Instead, they shall carry such insurance for as long as it is deemed necessary by them to cover similar activities. Upon cessation of activities related to this Agreement, the parties' obligation to maintain insurance ceases unless they deem it prudent to continue doing so.

Services Provision:

1. Duties and Responsibilities:
Client shall request services from Service Provider as mutually agreed upon in writing. Upon receipt of such written request, Service Provider shall endeavor to fulfill the request within a reasonable timeframe. The scope and extent of service provision shall be subject to Service Provider's discretion, and no guarantee can be given for the outcome or effectiveness of the services rendered.

2. Termination:
Either Party may terminate this agreement by providing written notice to the other Party. Upon termination, Client shall pay any outstanding fees due to Service Provider, as well as any reasonable costs associated with the termination process. Service Provider shall not be liable for any damages or losses suffered by Client as a result of termination, except in cases where such damages or losses were caused by the negligence or willful misconduct of Service Provider.

3. Warranties and Liabilities:
Service Provider makes no representations or warranties, express or implied, regarding the quality, suitability, or fitness for a particular purpose of any services provided under this agreement. Any claims arising from the services shall be governed by the limitations of liability set forth in this agreement, which shall apply regardless of the form of action, whether in contract, tort (including negligence), or otherwise. In no event shall Service Provider be liable for any indirect, special, incidental, punitive, or consequential damages arising out of or in connection with this agreement or the services provided under it.

4. Indemnification:
Client agrees to indemnify and hold harmless Service Provider, its officers, agents, employees, and affiliates from any and all claims, liabilities, expenses, and damages (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of or in connection with the Client's use of the services provided under this agreement.

5. Governing Law:
This agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [Jurisdiction], without giving effect to its conflict of laws principles. Any disputes arising out of or in connection with this agreement shall be resolved through binding arbitration in accordance with the rules of the [Arbitration Organization]. The decision of the arbitrator shall be final and binding upon both Parties, and judgment may be entered thereon in any court having jurisdiction.

6. Entire Agreement:
This agreement constitutes the entire understanding between the Parties regarding the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior or contemporaneous communications, representations, or agreements, whether oral or written. Any amendments or modifications to this agreement must be in writing and signed by both Parties.

original: Page 8 of 11 The Sales Team shall use only such marketing and other materials for the Product in the Territory as are expressly approved in writing in advance by Imprimis, are consistent in all respects with the external marketing of such Product by Imprimis, include all warnings and instructions applicable for the proper use of the Product, comply with all applicable laws and regulations in the Territory, and do not contain any claims regarding a Product or its performance that the Sales Team does not reasonably demonstrate are supported by such Product or its performance. The Sales Team has adequate experience and is knowledgeable in applicable state and federal laws and FDA regulations related to the sales and marketing of the Product in the Territory, including, but not limited to: Stark Law; Anti-Kickback Statute; Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act (Sections 503A and 503B); and Drug Quality and Security Act.

While the Sales Team is expected to have a fundamental understanding of applicable state and federal laws and FDA regulations pertaining to the sales and marketing of the Product within the Territory, including but not limited to: Stark Law, Anti-Kickback Statute, Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act (Sections 503A and 503B), and Drug Quality and Security Act, Imprimis accepts responsibility for ensuring that such compliance is maintained.

original: The Sales Team shall not make any warranty or claim, express or implied, relating to any Product other than those contained in any marketing materials provided by Imprimis to the Sales Team or otherwise expressly authorized in writing by Imprimis.

Compensation:

Upon the occurrence of an Event of Default by the Borrower, the Lender shall have the right, but not the obligation, to demand compensation from the Borrower in such amount as it deems appropriate, considering all relevant circumstances. The determination of appropriate compensation and the timing of any demand for payment shall be at the sole discretion of the Lender. In the event that the Borrower disputes the amount demanded by the Lender, the matter shall be subject to binding arbitration in accordance with the rules established by the American Arbitration Association. The Borrower acknowledges and agrees that any failure to make timely payment when due may result in additional charges or interest at the prevailing rate, as determined by the Lender in its sole discretion.

2. Milestone Compensations and Stock Grants: Conditions for Receipt

Upon the achievement of each designated milestone by the Contractor, the Purchaser shall have the option to compensate the Contractor with a payment or issue shares of its stock, at the discretion of the Purchaser. The Contractor's acceptance of such compensation or stock grants implies acknowledgment and agreement that these payments and issuances are contingent upon meeting specified milestones, and failure to do so shall not obligate the Purchaser to provide any additional compensation or share issuances.

original: c.Insider Trading Policy . If any shares of Common Stock are issued to Surgical, Surgical (or any related holder of Common Stock) shall be required to execute and follow Imprimis’ standard form insider trading policy.
modified: d. Insider Trading Policy . Should Surgical receive any shares of Common Stock, it is at its own discretion to comply with the Imprimis standard form insider trading policy; failure to do so will not constitute a breach of this agreement unless explicitly specified in writing by Imprimis.

Term and Termination:

The relationship established by this Agreement shall be deemed to have commenced as of the Effective Date specified herein and shall continue until terminated by either Party upon providing thirty (30) days' written notice, or in the event of a material breach or non-performance by the other Party, immediately upon delivery of written notice. The terminating Party shall have no further obligations or liabilities to the other Party following such termination.

However, it is understood that any remedies available at law or equity for past breaches or violations of this Agreement shall remain unaffected by this termination provision. Furthermore, each Party shall retain all rights and obligations under Sections X, Y, and Z of this Agreement, regardless of the status of the overall relationship.
